title: Fundamentals of RF Energy Harvesting Design and Deep Learning Utilization Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of electrical engineering, radio frequency (RF) concepts, and basic understanding of machine learning
context.additional_context: Learners understand RF energy harvesting system components through a real-world food sensor tag design case, apply a deep learning-based design framework to learn optimization methods. All sessions feature real-time discussions and hands-on practice on the Zoom platform.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the basic components of an RF energy harvesting system (antenna, impedance matching network, voltage multiplier).
Learners can predict RFEH circuit design parameters using a deep learning-based stacking ensemble learning (SEL) framework.
Learners can analyze simulation results applying multi-output regression (MOR) and multi-label classification (MLC) models.
Learners can propose an RFEH circuit design process applicable to real-world food quality monitoring systems.

resources: Python-Based Deep Learning Environment (Google Colab or Jupyter Notebook)
RF Simulation Software (e.g., CST Microwave Studio Demo Version)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
